original: @102a / /rgya gar skad du /

translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya ma h'a pra ti h'arya ni ra de sha n'a ma ma h'a ya na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya ma h'a pra ti h'arya ni ra de sha n'a ma ma h'a ya na s'u tra /
translated: Arya-Mahapratiharyya-nirdesha-nama-mahayanasutra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The noble great sutra called the teaching of the great miracle

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: First part

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Shravasti, in the Jeta Grove, in the garden of Anathapindika, together with a great assembly of 1,250 monks and 8,000 Bodhisattvas.

original: de nas lha'i bu ded dpon zhes bya @102b ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu ded dpon zhes bya @102b ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go /
translated: Then, the deva-son called Sārthavāha, who was present in that assembly, sat down.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go /
translated: The youthful Mañjuśrī was also present in that assembly.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the deva captain addressed the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa cho 'phrul du zhig gis sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa cho 'phrul du zhig gis sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad lags /
translated: by what miracles do the thus-gone ones tame beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; lha'i bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; lha'i bu /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Son of the gods,

original: nga ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //🔽gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do // gsum gang zhe na /
translated: I tame beings through three kinds of miracles.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are these three?🔽They are

original: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: the miracle of instruction, the miracle of teaching, and the miracle of miracles.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thus-gone ones’ miracle of instruction?

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen cing gzigs pa dang / dkon mchog gsum po dag la ma dad pa rnams dad par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen cing gzigs pa dang / dkon mchog gsum po dag la ma dad pa rnams dad par mdzad pa dang /
translated: It is the wisdom that is unimpeded in seeing the future. It is the knowledge and insight into the mental activity of all sentient beings. It is the faith that is generated in those who have no faith in the Three Jewels.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la 'jug pa mkhyen pa dang; de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag gang la da ltar byung ba na nyes par spyad pa'i gzhi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro gang yang rung ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ni de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi; gzhan du ma yin no zhes kun brjod par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la 'jug pa mkhyen pa dang; de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag gang la da ltar byung ba na nyes par spyad pa'i gzhi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro gang yang rung ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ni de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi; gzhan du ma yin no zhes kun brjod par mdzad pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the ripening of karma. It is the Tathāgata’s declaration that for a certain person, in the present, the basis of bad conduct will lead to birth in the lower realms, in any of the unfortunate existences, and that it will be just as he has said and not otherwise.

original: gang zag de sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ngan song rnams las thar nas lha dang mi dag tu skye bar 'gyur @103a *//
analyzed: gang zag de sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ngan song rnams las thar nas lha dang mi dag tu skye bar 'gyur @103a *//
translated: It is the knowledge that a person, through the cause of having taken up roots of virtue, will be liberated from the lower realms and will be reborn as a god or human.

original: zhing theg pa gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / yang na nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: zhing theg pa gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / yang na nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the field from which they will go forth,

original: yang na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: yang na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: whether it be the vehicle of the disciples,🔽the vehicle of the solitary sages,🔽or the Great Vehicle;🔽and likewise, the happiness and suffering they will experience,🔽the eon in which they will go forth,

original: yang na theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / bskal pa ji snyed gcig gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa ji lta bus sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / bskal pa ji snyed gcig gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa ji lta bus sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and the kind of conduct by which they will see the blessed buddhas🔽and please them.

original: mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all of that.

original: mkhyen nas kyang de ni de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang de ni de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Knowing it, he remains just as he is.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes de kho na bzhin du kun brjod par mdzad pa dang / gang zag gang dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus 'dod pa'i khams rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi skye mched gang yang rung ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes de kho na bzhin du kun brjod par mdzad pa dang / gang zag gang dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus 'dod pa'i khams rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi skye mched gang yang rung ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or will be reborn in the form realms, or will be reborn in the formless realms.🔽He knows by what vehicle they will go forth,🔽in how many eons they will go forth, and how many buddhas they will see

original: theg pa gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / bskal pa ji snyed cig gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa ji lta bus sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: theg pa gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / bskal pa ji snyed cig gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa ji lta bus sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and please by what kind of conduct.

original: mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mnyes par byed par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all of that.

original: mkhyen nas kyang de kho na bzhin du kun brjod cing lung ston par @103b mdzad pa dang / dge ba'am /
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang de kho na bzhin du kun brjod cing lung ston par @103b mdzad pa dang / dge ba'am /
translated: He does not pass over even a single thought of virtue

original: mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am /
translated: or nonvirtue,

original: dman pa'am / bar ma'am /🔽mchog gam / tha na sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: dman pa'am / bar ma'am / mchog gam / tha na sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mi 'da' ste /
translated: inferior or middling or superior.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: This is the Tathāgata’s miracle of teaching.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Tathāgata’s miracle of instruction?

original: bslab pa bsrung ba'i don gyi phyir rjes su ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bsrung ba'i don gyi phyir rjes su ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the instruction for the sake of guarding the training.

original: 'di ni bya ba'o //🔽'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba'o // 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‘This is to be done.🔽This is not to be done.

original: 'di ni bsten par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsten par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is to be relied upon.

original: 'di ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is to be accomplished.

original: 'di ni log par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni log par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is to be accomplished in the wrong way.

original: chos 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: These phenomena are associated with the side of affliction.

original: chos 'di dag ni rnam par byang ba'i cha dang mthun pa'o zhes de ltar yon tan thams cad yang dag par blang ba rjes su ston pa dang / mi dge ba thams cad spang ba rjes su ston pa dang / dge ba'i lam gyi tshogs thams cad rjes su ston pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rnam par byang ba'i cha dang mthun pa'o zhes de ltar yon tan thams cad yang dag par blang ba rjes su ston pa dang / mi dge ba thams cad spang ba rjes su ston pa dang / dge ba'i lam gyi tshogs thams cad rjes su ston pa dang /
translated: In this way, they teach the adoption of all good qualities, the abandonment of all nonvirtue, and the accumulation of all the requisites of the path.

original: lam 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lam 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This path is the completion of the vehicle of the hearers.

original: lam 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lam 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This path is the completion of the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: lam 'di ni theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes rjes su ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lam 'di ni theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes rjes su ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: This path is the completion of the Great Vehicle.’

original: de dag ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bsgrubs na gnas gang yin pa de rjes su 'thob par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin /🔽skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bsgrubs na gnas gang yin pa de rjes su 'thob par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin / skabs ma yin te /
translated: If they practice in accordance with what has been taught, it is impossible and cannot occur that they will not attain the state that they have been taught.

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and cannot occur.🔽It is impossible and cannot occur that they will not attain the state that they have been taught.

original: las 'di yang dag par blangs na ni sems can dmyal ba rnams su khrid par byed do //🔽las 'di yang dag par @104a *//
analyzed: las 'di yang dag par blangs na ni sems can dmyal ba rnams su khrid par byed do // las 'di yang dag par @104a *//
translated: If you adopt this action, it will lead you to the hells.

original: blangs na ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su khrid par byed do //
analyzed: blangs na ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su khrid par byed do //
translated: If you adopt this action, it will lead you to the animal realm.

original: las 'di yang dag par blangs na ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams su khrid par byed do //
analyzed: las 'di yang dag par blangs na ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams su khrid par byed do //
translated: If you adopt this action, it will lead you to the world of Yama.

original: las 'di yang dag par blangs na ni lha rnams su khrid par byed do //
analyzed: las 'di yang dag par blangs na ni lha rnams su khrid par byed do //
translated: If you adopt this action, it will lead you to the gods.

original: las 'di gang dag par blangs na ni mi rnams su khrid par byed do //
analyzed: las 'di gang dag par blangs na ni mi rnams su khrid par byed do //
translated: If you adopt this action, it will lead you to the human realm.

original: de la gang dag mi dge ba spangs na dge ba yang dag par blang ba'i phyir 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam du 'jug pa de dag ni lha dang mi rnams su skyes nas rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la gang dag mi dge ba spangs na dge ba yang dag par blang ba'i phyir 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam du 'jug pa de dag ni lha dang mi rnams su skyes nas rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those who engage in abandoning nonvirtue and adopting virtue, and who engage in the noble path, will be reborn as gods and humans and will eventually attain the Dharma of complete nirvāṇa.

original: tshul de lta bus kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rmongs pa med pa'i rjes su ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshul de lta bus kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rmongs pa med pa'i rjes su ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: In this way, he teaches without fault and without confusion.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: This is the miracle of instruction of the Tathagata.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the miracle of psychic power of the Tathagata?

original: gang dag rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pas bcom pa rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul kun tu ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: gang dag rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pas bcom pa rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul kun tu ston par mdzad de /
translated: For those sentient beings who are to be converted by psychic power, who are overcome by pride, conceit, and arrogance, he displays the miracle of psychic power.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gcig tu gyur nas du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gcig tu gyur nas du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: That is to say,🔽he becomes one and then becomes many;

original: du mar gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du mar gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: he becomes many and then becomes one;

original: snang bar 'gyur zhing mi snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro'o //🔽ra ba la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro'o //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur zhing mi snang bar 'gyur ro // rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro'o // ra ba la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro'o //
translated: he appears and then disappears;

original: ri la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro'o //
analyzed: ri la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro'o //
translated: he goes straight through a wall, through a rampart, through a mountain—as if through space;🔽he dives into the earth as if in water;🔽he walks on water without sinking as if on earth;

original: sa la steng du 'byung ba dang bye'u zul byed de /🔽dper na / chu la @104b bya ba bzhin no //🔽chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ste /
analyzed: sa la steng du 'byung ba dang bye'u zul byed de / dper na / chu la @104b bya ba bzhin no // chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ste /
translated: He emerges from the earth and dives into it as if it were water.

original: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no //🔽nam mkha' la yang 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no // nam mkha' la yang 'gro ste /
translated: He walks on water without sinking as if it were dry land.

original: dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //🔽lus kyi stod nas me 'bar bar byed cing lus kyi smad nas chu'i rgyun 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no // lus kyi stod nas me 'bar bar byed cing lus kyi smad nas chu'i rgyun 'bab par byed do //
translated: He travels through the sky even as far as the Brahma world, like a bird on the wing.🔽He even touches and strokes with his hand the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, and he wields bodily mastery even as far as the Brahma world.🔽He emits smoke and flames of fire from his body, so that he is like a great bonfire.🔽From the upper part of his body he emits water and fire, and from the lower part he emits water and fire.

original: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar bar byed cing lus kyi stod nas chu'i rgyun 'bab par byed do //🔽nyi ma dang / zla ba 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba; 'di ltar mthu che ba /🔽'di ltar gzi brjid che ba la yang lag pas 'dzin cing kun tu nyug par byed do //🔽tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar bar byed cing lus kyi stod nas chu'i rgyun 'bab par byed do //🔽nyi ma dang / zla ba 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba; 'di ltar mthu che ba /🔽'di ltar gzi brjid che ba la yang lag pas 'dzin cing kun tu nyug par byed do //🔽tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur ro //
translated: From the lower part of his body he emits water and fire, and from the upper part he emits water and fire.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di yang kun tu 'bar bar ston te /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di yang kun tu 'bar bar ston te /
translated: He can also display this great trichiliocosm as being ablaze.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i khyad par ci dang ci lta bus sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa dag mngon par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i khyad par ci dang ci lta bus sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa dag mngon par sgrub par byed de /
translated: He can manifest whatever kinds of miracles are necessary to tame beings, in whatever way is necessary to ripen beings.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: This is the Thus-Gone One’s miracle of supernormal knowledge.

original: lha'i bu / nga ni cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / nga ni cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //
translated: Divine son, I tame beings through these three miracles.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the god Sārthavāha said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: cho 'phrul de dag ma lags pa'i cho 'phrul dam pa gzhan ci zhig mnga' lags sam /
analyzed: cho 'phrul de dag ma lags pa'i cho 'phrul dam pa gzhan ci zhig mnga' lags sam /
translated: do you have any other, higher miracles than these?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: lha'i bu / yod do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / yod do //
translated: “Divine son, I do.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal @105a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal @105a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

translated: It is to explain the Dharma of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. It is to ripen beings who are established in error and affliction. It is to have the perfection of generosity in the Dharma of nonacceptance and nonrejection.

original: lus dang sems dben pa'i chos rnams la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa med pa'i chos rnams la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa dang / pha rol dang /🔽tshu rol med pa'i chos rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa dang / brtag pa dang / bsal ba med pa'i chos rnams la thabs mkhas pa yod pa dang / skyob pa med pa dang / rton pa med pa'i chos rnams la byams pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: lus dang sems dben pa'i chos rnams la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa med pa'i chos rnams la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa dang / pha rol dang / tshu rol med pa'i chos rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa dang / brtag pa dang / bsal ba med pa'i chos rnams la thabs mkhas pa yod pa dang / skyob pa med pa dang / rton pa med pa'i chos rnams la byams pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: The perfection of diligence is present in the phenomena of the isolation of body and mind. The perfection of concentration is present in the phenomena that are not contracted or distracted. The perfection of wisdom is present in the phenomena that are not beyond or near.🔽Skill in means is present in the phenomena that are not to be examined or eliminated. The cultivation of love is present in the phenomena that are not to be protected or relied upon.

original: bya ba med pa dang / gzhig pa med pa'i chos rnams la snying rjes sbyor ba dang / dga' ba med pa'i chos rnams la dga' ba mngon par sgrub pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i chos rnams la btang snyoms bsgom pa dang / shes pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba med pa dang / gzhig pa med pa'i chos rnams la snying rjes sbyor ba dang / dga' ba med pa'i chos rnams la dga' ba mngon par sgrub pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i chos rnams la btang snyoms bsgom pa dang / shes pa med pa dang /
translated: The application of compassion is present in the phenomena that are not to be done or destroyed. The accomplishment of joy is present in the phenomena that are not joyful. The cultivation of equanimity is present in the phenomena that are not to be settled.🔽The cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is present in the phenomena that are not to be known or cognized.

original: mthong ba med pa'i chos rnams la lha'i mig mngon par sgrub pa dang / thos pa med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa'i chos rnams la lha'i rna ba mngon par sgrub pa dang / dmigs @115a *//🔽pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par bral ba'i chos rnams la pha rol gyi sems shes pa yod pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang bral ba'i chos rnams la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa yod pa dang / sems dang /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa'i chos rnams la lha'i mig mngon par sgrub pa dang / thos pa med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa'i chos rnams la lha'i rna ba mngon par sgrub pa dang / dmigs @115a *// pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par bral ba'i chos rnams la pha rol gyi sems shes pa yod pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang bral ba'i chos rnams la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa yod pa dang / sems dang /
translated: It is to manifest the divine eye in relation to phenomena that are not seen. It is to manifest the divine ear in relation to phenomena that are not heard or cognized.

original: lus dang / sgra dang / brtson 'grus dang bral ba'i chos rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa 'thob pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i chos rnams la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos rnams la yang dag pa'i spong ba bsgom pa dang /

translated: It is to know the minds of others in relation to phenomena that are free from reference points, thoughts, and cognition. It is to know the recollection of past lives in relation to phenomena that are free from the limits of past and future. It is to attain the bases of miraculous power in relation to phenomena that are free from mind, body, sound, and effort. It is to cultivate the applications of mindfulness in relation to phenomena that are without location. It is to cultivate the authentic eliminations in relation to phenomena that are unborn and unceasing.

original: dbang po med pa'i chos rnams la dbang po bstan pa dang / stobs med pa dang / nyam chung ba'i chos rnams la stobs yongs su brjod pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i chos rnams la byang chub kyi yan lag bshad pa dang / khyad par med pa'i chos rnams la lam smos pa dang /

translated: It is to teach the faculties to those whose faculties are not yet mature. It is to describe the strengths to those whose strengths are not yet strong. It is to explain the branches of awakening to those whose qualities are not yet fully pacified. It is to speak of the path to those whose qualities are not yet distinguished.

original: zhi ba'i mthar song ba'i chos rnams la zhi gnas bskyed pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams la lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams la mya ngan las 'das par smon pa'o //

translated: It is to generate śamatha in those whose qualities have not yet reached the ultimate peace. It is to be skilled in vipaśyanā with regard to the qualities that are characterized by liberation. It is to aspire to nirvāṇa with regard to the qualities that are naturally in nirvāṇa.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ri rab lta bu des rgyal po dge ba'i bkod pa de dang / bu stong po de dag dang / btsun mo'i tshogs @115b de dag la cho 'phrul bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de nyid las brtsams te /

analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur bya bar mi nus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol la mi gnas pa yin pas /

analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur bya bar mi nus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhi zhing rab tu zhi la nye bar zhi ba yin pas /

analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur bya bar mi nus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni kha dog dang / gzugs dang / dbyibs dang bral ba yin pas /

analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur bya bar mi nus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du ma smad cing kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pas /

original: de la bsnyen bkur bya bar mi nus pa dang / btsun pa sh'a radva @127b ti'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du skur pa gdab tu med cing nam mkha' la bris pa lta bu yin pas /

translated: they are not the roots of the four errors,🔽they are not the roots of the five aggregates,🔽they are not the roots of the six sense sources,🔽they are not the roots of the seven abodes of consciousness,

translated: “The roots of virtue are not the roots of the five faculties, the six superknowledges, the seven branches of enlightenment, the eightfold path of the noble ones, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, or the ten powers of the thus-gone ones.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la lta ba skyed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos bcu la mngon par zhen pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no; ;phung po'i bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa dang /

translated: “The roots of virtue are not the roots of the five aggregates, the six sense sources, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold path of the noble ones, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, or the ten powers of the thus-gone ones.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue are those which are not the roots of the māra of the afflictions, those which are not the roots of the māra of death, and those which are not the roots of the māra of the sons of the gods.

original: sgrib pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / chod pa dang / kun nas ldang ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'gyod pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / chod pa dang / kun nas ldang ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'gyod pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue are those which are not the roots of obscurations, those which are not the roots of interruptions, those which are not the roots of agitation, and those which are not the roots of regret.

original: bdag tu lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / sems can du lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / srog tu lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / sems can du lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / srog tu lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue are those which are not the roots of the view of a self, those which are not the roots of the view of a sentient being, those which are not the roots of the view of a life-force, those which are not the roots of the view of a nourisher, and those which are not the roots of the view of a person.

original: 'byung bar lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'jig par lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / chad par lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / rtag par lta ba rtsa ba ma @128b yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'jig par lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / chad par lta ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / rtag par lta ba rtsa ba ma @128b yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The view of origination is not a root, the view of destruction is not a root, the view of annihilation is not a root, and the view of permanence is not a root.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / ma rig pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'du byed rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / ming dang gzugs rtsa ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / ma rig pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / 'du byed rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / ming dang gzugs rtsa ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: Incorrectness is not a root, ignorance is not a root, formations are not a root, consciousness is not a root, name-and-form is not a root,

original: skye mched drug rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / reg pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / tshor ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / sred pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / len pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / srid pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: skye mched drug rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / reg pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / tshor ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / sred pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / len pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / srid pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: the six sense bases are not a root, contact is not a root, feeling is not a root, craving is not a root, grasping is not a root, becoming is not a root,

original: skye ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / rga shi rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / nad dang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / rga shi rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / nad dang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Birth is not a root, old age and death are not a root, suffering, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair are not a root.

original: 'dod pa'i khams rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs kyi khams rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs kyi khams rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The desire realm is not a root, the form realm is not a root, the formless realm is not a root.

original: sbyin pas rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pas rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Generosity is not a root, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are not roots.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyis rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyis rlom sems su byed pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas are not the roots of virtue that are the basis for the four immeasurables—love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dod pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dod pa rtsa ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas are not the roots of virtue that are the basis for the desire for the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha results.

original: byams @129a *// pa chen po'i rtsa ba dang / snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi 'dor ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rtsa ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: byams @129a *// pa chen po'i rtsa ba dang / snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi 'dor ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rtsa ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: The roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas are the roots of virtue that are the basis for great love, the roots of virtue that are the basis for great compassion, the roots of virtue that are the basis for not abandoning the mind of omniscience, the roots of virtue that are the basis for bringing sentient beings to maturity, the roots of virtue that are the basis for upholding the true Dharma,

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i rtsa ba dang / tshul khrims dang bslab pa thams cad yang dag par len pa'i rtsa ba dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang /
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rtsa ba dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i rtsa ba dang / tshul khrims dang bslab pa thams cad yang dag par len pa'i rtsa ba dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang /
translated: the root of giving away all possessions, the root of not hoping for karmic ripening, the root of taking up all ethics and training, the root of not desiring Śakra, Brahmā, or

original: 'jig rten skyong ba yang mi 'dod pa'i rtsa ba dang / bzod pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / nges pa'i rtsa ba dang / bdag dang gzhan la yang mi gnod pa'i rtsa ba dang / brtan pa'i brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba yang mi 'dod pa'i rtsa ba dang / bzod pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / nges pa'i rtsa ba dang / bdag dang gzhan la yang mi gnod pa'i rtsa ba dang / brtan pa'i brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: the world guardians, the root of patience, peace, and discipline, the root of not harming oneself or others, the root of undertaking stable great diligence,

original: dman pa'i chos yang dag par mi sdud pa'i rtsa ba dang / bsam gtan gyi rtsa ba dang / bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar mi byed pa'i rtsa ba dang / shes rab kyi rtsa ba dang / btang snyoms kyang ma yin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: dman pa'i chos yang dag par mi sdud pa'i rtsa ba dang / bsam gtan gyi rtsa ba dang / bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar mi byed pa'i rtsa ba dang / shes rab kyi rtsa ba dang / btang snyoms kyang ma yin pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: the root of not gathering inferior teachings, the root of concentration, the root of not relishing the taste of concentration, the root of wisdom, the root of not being indifferent,

original: thabs kyi rtsa ba dang / thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi rtsa ba dang / thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The root of the means and the root of the engagement in all is the wholesome root of the bodhisattva.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i rtsa ba dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa'i rtsa ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrub pa'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i rtsa ba dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa'i rtsa ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrub pa'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The root of the continuity of the lineage of the Three Jewels, the root of the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness, and the root of the accomplishment of all the qualities of the Buddha is the wholesome root of the bodhisattva.

original: @129b lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rgyun gyi rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: @129b lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rgyun gyi rtsa ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The root of the continuity of body, speech and mind is the wholesome root of the bodhisattva.

original: gzungs kyi shes pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //

translated: Those who do not put down do not grasp. Those who do not grasp do not hold as supreme. Those who do not hold as supreme do not have error. Those who do not have error do not have falsity.

translated: Those who are free from falsity have correct practice. Those who have correct practice have correct view. Those who have correct view have correct effort, and so on, up to correct samādhi.

translated: In the absence of seeing, there is no torment. In the absence of torment, there is no discouragement. In the absence of discouragement, there is no cause for affliction. In the absence of affliction, there is clarity and illumination.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa gang yin /
translated: Then the deva Sārthavāha said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, “Mañjuśrī, what is the knowledge of bodhisattvas?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: lha'i bu / sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'i shes pa dang / phung po yongs su spangs pa la yongs su skyo ba med pa'i shes pa @132b dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsdu ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'i shes pa dang / phung po yongs su spangs pa la yongs su skyo ba med pa'i shes pa @132b dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsdu ba shes pa dang /
translated: “Son of the gods, it is the knowledge of fully understanding suffering, the knowledge of not being discouraged by fully abandoning the aggregates, the knowledge of the origin, the knowledge of gathering the roots of virtue,

original: 'gog pa shes pa dang / skye ba shes pa dang / 'byung ba shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / lam ngan pa rnam par bcad pa shes pa dang / rgyu shes pa dang / chud mi za ba shes pa dang / 'bras bu shes pa dang /🔽mngon sum du bya ba spangs pa shes pa dang / rkyen shes pa dang / tshogs bsags pa shes pa dang / bden pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la lta zhing thob par bya ba shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa dang / skye ba shes pa dang / 'byung ba shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / lam ngan pa rnam par bcad pa shes pa dang / rgyu shes pa dang / chud mi za ba shes pa dang / 'bras bu shes pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba spangs pa shes pa dang / rkyen shes pa dang / tshogs bsags pa shes pa dang / bden pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la lta zhing thob par bya ba shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of arising, the knowledge of occurrence, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of the elimination of bad paths, the knowledge of causes, the knowledge of non-wastefulness, the knowledge of results,🔽the knowledge of the abandonment of direct realization, the knowledge of conditions, the knowledge of the accumulation of the collections, the knowledge of the truths, the knowledge of seeing and attaining the wisdom of the buddhas, and the knowledge of dependent origination.

original: 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pa med pa shes pa dang / phung po lnga shes pa dang / phung po'i bdud spangs pa shes pa dang / khams shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes pa dang / skye mched shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pa med pa shes pa dang / phung po lnga shes pa dang / phung po'i bdud spangs pa shes pa dang / khams shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes pa dang / skye mched shes pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of non-attachment to occurrence, the knowledge of the five aggregates, the knowledge of the abandonment of the demon of the aggregates, the knowledge of the elements, the knowledge of the indivisibility of the dharmadhātu, the knowledge of the sense bases,

original: grong stong pa lta bu so sor rtog pa shes pa dang / sbyin pa shes pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa las mi 'da' ba shes pa dang / tshul khrims shes pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: grong stong pa lta bu so sor rtog pa shes pa dang / sbyin pa shes pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa las mi 'da' ba shes pa dang / tshul khrims shes pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the empty village. It is to know generosity. It is to know the right time and the wrong time. It is to know discipline. It is to know how to ripen beings with incorrect discipline.

original: bzod pa shes pa dang / sems can rjes su bsrung ba shes pa dang / brtson 'grus shes pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las bya ba shes pa dang / bsam gtan shes pa dang / bsam gtan las ldog pa shes pa dang / shes rab shes pa dang /
analyzed: bzod pa shes pa dang / sems can rjes su bsrung ba shes pa dang / brtson 'grus shes pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las bya ba shes pa dang / bsam gtan shes pa dang / bsam gtan las ldog pa shes pa dang / shes rab shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know patience. It is to know how to protect beings. It is to know diligence. It is to know how to do good deeds. It is to know concentration. It is to know how to emerge from concentration. It is to know insight.

original: lta ba yongs su shes pa dang / thabs shes pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par @133a *//
analyzed: lta ba yongs su shes pa dang / thabs shes pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par @133a *//
translated: It is to know views. It is to know means. It is to know how to ripen beings.

original: bya ba shes pa dang / byams pa shes pa dang / sems can bskyab pa shes pa dang / snying rje shes pa dang / yongs su mi skyo ba shes pa dang / dga' ba shes pa dang / chos la dga' zhing rab tu dga' la mchog tu dga' ba shes pa dang /🔽btang snyoms shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsgrub pa shes pa dang / sems can gzhug pa shes pa dang / tha snyad shes pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes pa dang / gnas med pa la gnas pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba shes pa dang / byams pa shes pa dang / sems can bskyab pa shes pa dang / snying rje shes pa dang / yongs su mi skyo ba shes pa dang / dga' ba shes pa dang / chos la dga' zhing rab tu dga' la mchog tu dga' ba shes pa dang / btang snyoms shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsgrub pa shes pa dang / sems can gzhug pa shes pa dang / tha snyad shes pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes pa dang / gnas med pa la gnas pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know what to do. It is to know love. It is to know how to protect beings. It is to know compassion. It is to know how to not be discouraged. It is to know joy. It is to know how to delight in, rejoice in, and be elated by the Dharma.🔽It is to know equanimity. It is to know how to accomplish the qualities of the Buddha. It is to know how to guide beings. It is to know conventions. It is to know the applications of mindfulness. It is to know how to abide without abiding.

original: yang dag par spong ba shes pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang mi 'gal ba shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa shes pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par so sor rtog pa shes pa dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba shes pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang mi 'gal ba shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa shes pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par so sor rtog pa shes pa dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: It is to know the correct exertions. It is to know how to not contradict sameness. It is to know the bases of miraculous power. It is to know how to discern without formation. It is to know the faculty of faith.

original: stobs shes pa dang; chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba shes pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa shes pa dang; dran pa'i dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang /
analyzed: stobs shes pa dang; chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba shes pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa shes pa dang; dran pa'i dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang /
translated: the faculty and power of diligence, knowing the transcendence of all attachments,🔽the faculty and power of mindfulness, knowing the non-forgetfulness of all phenomena,🔽the faculty and power of absorption, knowing the sameness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad mi brjed pa shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi brjed pa shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / stobs shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang /
translated: the faculty and power of wisdom, knowing the faculties of all beings, whether superior or not,🔽the branches of awakening, knowing the realization of self-arisen wisdom,

original: mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / byang chub kyi yan @133b lag shes pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / lam ngan pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / byang chub kyi yan @133b lag shes pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / lam ngan pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the path, knowing the transcendence of all bad paths,

original: snying rje chen po la lhag par dmigs pa shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mi zad pa shes pa dang / skye ba med pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la lhag par dmigs pa shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mi zad pa shes pa dang / skye ba med pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to focus on great compassion. It is to know how to exhaust all roots of virtue. It is to know how to attain acceptance of the unborn nature of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su grub pa shes pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba shes pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su grub pa shes pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba shes pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to recollect the Buddha. It is to know how to perfect the body of a buddha. It is to know how to recollect the Dharma. It is to know how to turn the wheel of the Dharma. It is to know how to recollect the Saṅgha.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yang dag par 'du ba shes pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba shes pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yang dag par 'du ba shes pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba shes pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to gather the Saṅgha of irreversible bodhisattvas. It is to know how to recollect generosity. It is to know how to never abandon any being. It is to know how to recollect discipline.

original: smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba shes pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sdig pa thams cad mi bya bar shes pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po shes pa dang / rim pa rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba shes pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sdig pa thams cad mi bya bar shes pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po shes pa dang / rim pa rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to fulfill all aspirations. It is to know how to recollect the gods. It is to know how to not commit any negative actions. It is to know the faculties of sentient beings. It is to know how to realize the stages.

original: thos pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba shes pa dang / tshogs thams cad kyis mi ngoms pa shes pa dang / sman thams cad shes pa dang / rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba shes pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba shes pa dang / tshogs thams cad kyis mi ngoms pa shes pa dang / sman thams cad shes pa dang / rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba shes pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to complete the accumulation of hearing. It is to know how to not be satisfied with any accumulation. It is to know all medicines. It is to know how to apply them according to the circumstances. It is to know what is possible and what is impossible.

original: gnas ma yin pa mi bya bar shes pa dang / stobs bcu shes pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang @134a *//
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa mi bya bar shes pa dang / stobs bcu shes pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang @134a *//
translated: It is to know how to not do what is impossible. It is to know the ten powers. It is to know the śrāvakas’

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi theg pa dang rjes su mthun pa shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa shes pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang bar du gcod pa ma yin pa'i chos rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs pa'i shes pa dang /🔽rnam par shes pa mi gnas par shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma thogs pa'i shes pa dang / chos thams cad las yang dag par mi 'da' ba shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma thogs pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi theg pa dang rjes su mthun pa shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa shes pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang bar du gcod pa ma yin pa'i chos rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa mi gnas par shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma thogs pa'i shes pa dang / chos thams cad las yang dag par mi 'da' ba shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma thogs pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know what is in accord with the vehicles of all buddhas. It is to know fearlessness. It is to know the realization of what is an obstacle and what is not an obstacle. It is to know the past without impediment.🔽It is to know consciousness without abiding. It is to know the future without impediment. It is to know not to transcend any phenomena. It is to know the present without impediment.

original: gnas pa med pa dang / rab tu gnas pa med pa shes pa dang / lus sngon du 'gro ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus la 'jug pa shes pa dang / ngag sngon du 'gro ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sgra rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa dang / rab tu gnas pa med pa shes pa dang / lus sngon du 'gro ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus la 'jug pa shes pa dang / ngag sngon du 'gro ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sgra rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know nonabiding and nonestablishment. It is to know the body. It is to know the engagement of the bodies of all beings. It is to know speech. It is to know the classification of the sounds of all beings.

original: yid sngon du 'gro ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnam par g-yo ba rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'khrul pa rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: yid sngon du 'gro ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnam par g-yo ba rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'khrul pa rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the mind that precedes the mental afflictions, the knowledge of the mental activity and movements of all sentient beings, the knowledge of non-delusion, the knowledge of the delusion of all sentient beings,

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba shes pa dang / mi brjed pa'i shes pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems can dran pa la 'jog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba shes pa dang / mi brjed pa'i shes pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems can dran pa la 'jog pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of being free from the mental afflictions, the knowledge of pacifying the mental afflictions and disputes of all sentient beings, the knowledge of non-forgetfulness, the knowledge of establishing the distracted minds of sentient beings in mindfulness,

original: dgongs pa rab tu @134b 'dzin pa shes pa dang / sems can le lo can yongs su bzung ba shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa shes pa dang / gdul ba'i sems can 'dul ba rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: dgongs pa rab tu @134b 'dzin pa shes pa dang / sems can le lo can yongs su bzung ba shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa shes pa dang / gdul ba'i sems can 'dul ba rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of upholding the intention, the knowledge of guiding lazy sentient beings, the knowledge of the unique qualities of the Buddha, the knowledge of guiding the sentient beings to be guided,

original: thabs shes pa dang / shes rab shes pa ste /
analyzed: thabs shes pa dang / shes rab shes pa ste /
translated: the knowledge of means, and the knowledge of wisdom.

original: lha'i bu / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: Divine son, that is the bodhisattva’s knowledge.

original: shes pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes chags pa med pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: shes pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes chags pa med pa 'thob bo //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses that knowledge attains the unattached wisdom of the buddhas.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dang / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa de ni ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dang / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa de ni ngo mtshar te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, the inconceivability of the bodhisattvas’ knowledge and the knowledge that is superior to the three worlds is amazing.

original: shes pa de ni go cha ngan ngon dang ldan pas yang dag par bsdu bar mi nus so //
analyzed: shes pa de ni go cha ngan ngon dang ldan pas yang dag par bsdu bar mi nus so //
translated: That knowledge cannot be gathered by those who wear inferior armor.

original: 'jam dpal gang de lta bu'i shes pa skyed par byed pa de yang cho 'phrul chen po yin no ////🔽bam po gsum pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang de lta bu'i shes pa skyed par byed pa de yang cho 'phrul chen po yin no //// bam po gsum pa ste tha ma /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the generation of such knowledge is also a great miracle.”

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' go cha legs par bgos pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' go cha legs par bgos pa yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, how is it that bodhisattvas are well-armored?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,🔽“Divine son, it is like this.

original: lha'i bu / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems can rnams la skrag par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' ni go cha legs par bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems can rnams la skrag par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' ni go cha legs par bgos pa yin no //
translated: Divine Prince, when a Bodhisattva is not afraid of beings who are by nature in a state of parinirvana, he is said to be wearing the armor well.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Divine Prince,

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya /
translated: why is a Bodhisattva called a Bodhisattva?🔽”

original: @135a *// smras pa; lha'i bu /
analyzed: @135a *// smras pa; lha'i bu /
translated: The Bodhisattva Maitreya replied, “Divine Prince,

original: byang chub kyi gnas rjes su 'jug pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi gnas rjes su 'jug pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called a Bodhisattva because he is dedicated to the attainment of enlightenment.🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /

translated: The Bodhisattva Vimalakīrti continued, “Divine Prince,

original: ci'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya /
translated: why is a Bodhisattva called a ‘great being’?

original: smras pa / lha'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / lha'i bu /
translated: The Buddha replied, Son of the gods!

original: rtsom pa chen po nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa dang / ye shes chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //🔽smras pa / 'jam dpal; ci'i phyir sems can mchog ces bya /
analyzed: rtsom pa chen po nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa dang / ye shes chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o // smras pa / 'jam dpal; ci'i phyir sems can mchog ces bya /
translated: The Bodhisattva Maitreya replied, “He is called a ‘great being’ because he is dedicated to the great enterprise and to the perfection of great knowledge.🔽”🔽The Bodhisattva Vimalakīrti continued, “Divine Prince,

original: smras pa / lha'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / lha'i bu /
translated: why is a Bodhisattva called the foremost of beings?🔽”

original: shes rab kyis gzung ba med pa'i chos la 'jug pa dang / thabs kyis chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pas de'i phyir sems can mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis gzung ba med pa'i chos la 'jug pa dang / thabs kyis chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pas de'i phyir sems can mchog ces bya'o //
translated: “Wisdom” refers to the fact that they engage with phenomena that are ungraspable. “Skillful means” refers to the fact that they gather all phenomena. For these reasons, they are called “supreme beings.”🔽

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Śakra said, “Mañjuśrī,

analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can dag pa zhes bya /
translated: why are they called ‘pure beings’?🔽”

original: smras pa / lha'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / lha'i bu /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Divine son,

original: gang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas shing /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas shing /
translated: it is because they do not abide with the stains of the afflictions

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par yang byed pas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par yang byed pas /
translated: and because they strive to eliminate the afflictions of all beings

original: de'i phyir sems can dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that they are called ‘pure beings.’🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
