translated: “Divine son, those who bring sentient beings to full maturity through equality and inequality

original: mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi 'da' ba 'di yang cho 'phrul chen po yin no //🔽de la mnyam pa nyid ni gang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi 'da' ba 'di yang cho 'phrul chen po yin no // de la mnyam pa nyid ni gang /
translated: This is also a great miracle.🔽What is sameness?

original: mi mnyam pa nyid ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is not sameness?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: All dharmas are the same in emptiness. This is sameness.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not enter into emptiness, they are not the same.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang stong pa nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang stong pa nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: The bodhisattva brings them to maturity, but does not move from the sameness of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: All dharmas are the same in signlessness. This is sameness.

original: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not enter into this sameness, they are not the same.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin kyang mtshan ma med pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin kyang mtshan ma med pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: The bodhisattva brings them to maturity, but does not move from the sameness of signlessness.

original: chos @143a *// thams cad smon pa med par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos @143a *// thams cad smon pa med par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: The sameness of all phenomena in the sameness of wishlessness is sameness.

original: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not engage in that sameness abide in what is not sameness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang /
translated: Bodhisattvas bring them to maturity

original: smon pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: but do not waver from the sameness of wishlessness.

original: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: The sameness of all phenomena in the sameness of the absence of volitional activity is sameness.

original: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not engage in that sameness abide in what is not sameness.🔽Bodhisattvas bring them to maturity

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: but do not waver from the sameness of the absence of volitional activity.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang / 'byung ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang / 'gag pa med par mnyam pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar mnyam pa nyid dang / dben par mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po med par mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang / 'byung ba med par mnyam pa nyid dang / 'gag pa med par mnyam pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar mnyam pa nyid dang / dben par mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po med par mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: All phenomena are the same in being unborn, the same in being unarisen, the same in being unceasing, the same in being free from desire, the same in being isolated, the same in being insubstantial,

original: 'gog par mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gog par mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mnyam pa nyid du mnyam pa de ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: the same in being nonexistent, the same in being non-entities, the same in being empty, the same in being signless, the same in being wishless, the same in being unconditioned, the same in being unobservable, the same in being unproduced, the same in being unarisen, the same in being unceased, the same in being free from defilements, the same in being purified, the same in being without increase, the same in being without decrease, the same in being without coming, the same in being without going, the same in being without location, the same in being without support, the same in being without basis, the same in being without foundation, the same in being without basis of foundation, the same in being without basis of non-foundation, the same in being without basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, the same in being without basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis of non-basis, and the same in being nirvāṇa.

original: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mnyam pa nyid de la mi 'jug pa de dag ni mi mnyam par mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not engage with that sameness are the same in being unequal.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag yongs su smin par byed kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo ste /
translated: Even though bodhisattvas bring them to maturity, they do not waver from the sameness of nirvāṇa.

original: lha'i @143b bu; de ltar mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i @143b bu; de ltar mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Divine Prince, bodhisattvas who practice

original: de nas lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the deva Sārthavāha said to the youthful Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa la spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa la spobs par gyis shig /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, be confident in teaching the conduct of the bodhisattvas!”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: “Divine son, the conduct of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable.”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Sārthavāha asked,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how is the conduct of the bodhisattvas inconceivable?”🔽Mañjuśrī replied,

original: smras pa / lha'i bu; 'dod chags kyi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / lha'i bu; 'dod chags kyi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: “Divine son, the conduct of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable because the conduct of desire is inconceivable.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i spyod pa ni ma yin no; ;zhe sdang gi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i spyod pa ni ma yin no; ;zhe sdang gi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable because the conduct of desire is inconceivable, not because the conduct of freedom from desire is inconceivable.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable because the conduct of anger is inconceivable.🔽The conduct of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable because the conduct of anger is inconceivable, not because the conduct of freedom from anger is inconceivable.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //🔽gti mug gi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i spyod pa ni ma yin no // gti mug gi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not a practice that is free from anger.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is inconceivable because the practice of delusion is inconceivable.

original: shes rab kyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a practice that accomplishes the activity of wisdom.

original: ser sna med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: ser sna med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is a practice of non-stinginess.

original: sbyin pas rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //🔽'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang bral ba'i spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pas rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no // 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang bral ba'i spyod pa ni /
translated: It is not a practice that is conceited about generosity.

original: @144a *// byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: @144a *// byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is a practice free from immorality.

original: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a practice that is conceited about morality.

original: gnod sems med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod sems med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is a practice free from malice.

original: bzod pas rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzod pas rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a practice that is conceited about patience.

original: le lo med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: le lo med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of those who are free of laziness.

original: brtson 'grus kyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is not the practice of those who are proud of their effort.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of those who are free of distraction.

original: bsam gtan gyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is not the practice of those who are proud of their concentration.

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of those who are free of false wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is not the practice of those who are proud of their wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa med pas rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa med pas rlom sems su byed pa'i spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of those who are free of afflictions.🔽The practice of the bodhisattvas is not the practice of those who are proud of their freedom from afflictions.

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong bas brtse ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong bas brtse ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to give away all inner and outer things without any sense of loss.

original: bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma yongs su gtong bas mngon par dga' ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma yongs su gtong bas mngon par dga' ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to give away sons, daughters, and wives without any sense of loss.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la smod pas rtag tu gnod sems med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams @144b kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la smod pas rtag tu gnod sems med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams @144b kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to be without any malice at all, always denouncing the pleasures of the senses.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsdus pas mi lta ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsdus pas mi lta ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to be without any pride, gathering the roots of virtue.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta bas lta ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta bas lta ba med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to be without any views, not caring about body or life.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa yongs su gtong bas tsham tshom med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa yongs su gtong bas tsham tshom med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to act without hesitation, giving up both the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: 'khor ba dpag tu med pas mi skrag pas 'jigs pa med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba dpag tu med pas mi skrag pas 'jigs pa med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to act without fear, not being frightened by the immensity of cyclic existence.

original: sems can thams cad kyi khur sgrol bas khur chen po sgrol ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi khur sgrol bas khur chen po sgrol ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to act to remove the great burden, liberating all sentient beings from their burden.

original: sngar dam bcas pa nyams su len par byed pas phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar dam bcas pa nyams su len par byed pas phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to act without turning back, fulfilling their former promises.

original: rjes su 'gyod pa med pas yid la gcags pa med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gyod pa med pas yid la gcags pa med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is to act without regret, being free of remorse.

original: theg pa thams cad zil gyis mnan pas mngon par 'phags pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad zil gyis mnan pas mngon par 'phags pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is the conduct that is exalted above all vehicles.

original: yi dam ma zhig pas go cha rdo rje lta bu'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: yi dam ma zhig pas go cha rdo rje lta bu'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is the conduct that is like a diamond, not breaking its vow.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems la nges par sems pas rang gi sems la nges par sems pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //🔽las byas pa chud mi za bas chud mi za ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams @145a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems la nges par sems pas rang gi sems la nges par sems pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no // las byas pa chud mi za bas chud mi za ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams @145a *//
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is the conduct that is certain in one’s own mind, being certain in the minds of all sentient beings.

original: kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is the conduct that is not wasted, not wasting the karma that has been done.

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pas tha dad med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pas tha dad med pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is the conduct that is without distinction, having an attitude of equality toward all sentient beings.

original: dgra thams cad nges par bcom pas dpa' ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra thams cad nges par bcom pas dpa' ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is the conduct of a hero, having definitely conquered all enemies.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i skye bo dang mthun par 'jug pas ma 'dres pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //🔽gshe ba dang / sdang ba thams cad rab tu dga' bar byed pas /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i skye bo dang mthun par 'jug pas ma 'dres pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no // gshe ba dang / sdang ba thams cad rab tu dga' bar byed pas /
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is the unmixed practice, since it is engaged in according with beings of equal lot.

original: rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is the practice of delight, since it delights all those who are angry and hostile.

original: sangs rgyas lta ba dang / chos mnyan pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba la mchog tu dga' bas dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lta ba dang / chos mnyan pa dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba la mchog tu dga' bas dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice is the practice of delight, since it delights in seeing the Buddha, in listening to the teaching, and in serving the teacher, with the highest delight, joy, and satisfaction.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgyan par byed pas rgyan gyi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no; ;mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i gnyen por gyur pas zil gyis mi non pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / sems dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgyan par byed pas rgyan gyi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no; ;mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i gnyen por gyur pas zil gyis mi non pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ practice is the practice of adornment, adorning the body, speech, mind, and buddha-field. The bodhisattvas’ practice is the practice of invincibility, being invincible to the reactive emotions and to the gods and demons.

original: skye bo mkhas shing mdzangs pa rnams kyis rab tu bsngags pas ngan pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo mkhas shing mdzangs pa rnams kyis rab tu bsngags pas ngan pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ practice is the practice of the good, praised by the wise and the holy.

original: tshul bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu nges par brtags pas mi rtsi @145b ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu nges par brtags pas mi rtsi @145b ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ practice is the practice of the uncontrived, not being contrived by reactive emotions.

original: khur blangs pa nyams su lon pas skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: khur blangs pa nyams su lon pas skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ practice is the practice of the heroic, taking up the burden and carrying it.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pos phyir mi ldog pas khyad par du 'gro ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pos phyir mi ldog pas khyad par du 'gro ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of the irreversible progress of firm effort.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yang dag par sdud pas chos spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yang dag par sdud pas chos spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of the Dharma, which is the gathering of the elements of enlightenment.🔽The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of gratitude, which is the continuity of the lineage of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pas byas pa shes shing byas pa gzo ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no; ;dkon mchog gsum 'dri bar mi byed pas dkon mchog gi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pas byas pa shes shing byas pa gzo ba'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no; ;dkon mchog gsum 'dri bar mi byed pas dkon mchog gi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of the Three Jewels, which is the nonabandonment of the Three Jewels.

original: yin no // sdud pa dang yongs su gcod pas shes rab dang thabs kyi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // sdud pa dang yongs su gcod pas shes rab dang thabs kyi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is the practice of wisdom and means, which is the gathering and the cutting off.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this teaching of the practice of the bodhisattvas was taught,

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgyas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //🔽de nas lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgyas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to // de nas lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Five hundred bodhisattvas who had entered the conduct attained forbearance with respect to the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa de ni legs par smras so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa de ni legs par smras so //
translated: Then the deva captain said to youthful Manjushri, “Manjushri, you have spoken well about the conduct of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag spyod pa de dang ma bral ba de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag spyod pa de dang ma bral ba de dag ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who are not separate from that conduct

original: de nyid kyis lung bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis lung bstan pa yin no //
translated: have been prophesied by that very fact.”

original: bcom ldan @146a *//🔽'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan @146a *// 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The bhagavat said,

original: lha'i bu / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: “deva, it is so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: lha'i bu / gang gi tshe nga spyod pa de dang ma bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang gi tshe nga spyod pa de dang ma bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis /
translated: deva, when I was not separate from that conduct, the tathagata Dipamkara

original: nga bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te /
analyzed: nga bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te /
translated: prophesied that I would attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: der ngas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: der ngas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: There I attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: lha'i bu / gang spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams la /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams la /
translated: Divine son, the bodhisattvas’ conduct, which is the purification of conduct,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa de lta bu de dag rab tu 'byed par byed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen po yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa de lta bu de dag rab tu 'byed par byed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen po yin no //
translated: is also the thus-gone ones’ great miracle.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: ” Then the god Sārthavāha said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni ci lags /
analyzed: mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni ci lags /
translated: what is meant by ‘unborn’?

original: 'jug pa gang gis ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa lags /
analyzed: 'jug pa gang gis ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa lags /
translated: Through what engagement do bodhisattvas attain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: lha'i bu / mi skye ba zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / mi skye ba zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: “Divine son, ‘unborn’

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i mu'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin te /🔽de ni sngon byung bar gyur la /
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i mu'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin te / de ni sngon byung bar gyur la /
translated: is a term that refers to the characteristic of the limit of non-arising.🔽It is not something that existed in the past

original: phyis ma byung bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis ma byung bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: and later came to be nonexistent.

original: de ni gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid yin no //🔽de ni sngon srid par gyur la /🔽phyis mi srid par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid yin no // de ni sngon srid par gyur la / phyis mi srid par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It has never not existed.

original: de ni gzod ma nas mi srid pa nyid yin no //🔽de ni sngon skyes par gyur la /
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nas mi srid pa nyid yin no // de ni sngon skyes par gyur la /
translated: It is not that it existed before and later became nonexistent.🔽It has never existed.

original: phyis ma skyes par gyur pa ma yin te /🔽de ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid yin @146b no; ;de ni sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa yin la /🔽phyis mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis ma skyes par gyur pa ma yin te / de ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid yin @146b no; ;de ni sngon mngon par 'dus byas pa yin la / phyis mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it was born before and later became unborn.🔽It has never been born.

original: de ni gzod ma nas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin no //🔽de ni sngon yod par gyur la /🔽phyis med par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin no // de ni sngon yod par gyur la / phyis med par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it was produced before and later became unproduced.🔽It has never been produced.🔽It is not that it existed before and later became nonexistent.

original: de ni gzod ma nas 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin no //🔽de ni sngon gang zag tu bgrang bar gyur la /
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nas 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin no // de ni sngon gang zag tu bgrang bar gyur la /
translated: It has never changed.

original: phyis gang zag tu mi bgrang bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis gang zag tu mi bgrang bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it was counted as a person before and later became uncountable as a person.

original: de ni gzod ma nas stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nas stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: It has always been empty.

original: de ni sngon mtshan mar bgrang bar gyur la /
analyzed: de ni sngon mtshan mar bgrang bar gyur la /
translated: Previously, they were counted as signs.🔽

original: phyis mtshan mar mi bgrang bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis mtshan mar mi bgrang bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they were previously counted as signs and later became signless.

original: de ni gzod ma nas mtshan ma med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nas mtshan ma med pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are primordially signless.

original: gang gis de ltar rjes su rtogs pa dang / sems kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa la mngon par zhen pa med par rtogs pa de ni mi skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar rjes su rtogs pa dang / sems kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa la mngon par zhen pa med par rtogs pa de ni mi skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One who realizes this and who realizes the non-fixation of the arising and perishing of mind is said to be “non-arising.”

original: de la bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is patience?

original: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience with regard to all sentient beings is said to be patience, just as they are non-arising.

original: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du zhing thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du zhing thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience with regard to all fields is said to be patience, just as they are non-arising.

original: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience with regard to all those in training, those no longer in training, and the pratyekabuddhas is said to be patience, just as they are non-arising.

original: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as they are non-arising,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And the acceptance of all the qualities of the Buddha, of all the practices of the bodhisattva, and of all the buddhas is called acceptance.

original: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du /🔽chos thams cad @147a *//
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mi skye ba de bzhin du / chos thams cad @147a *//
translated: And just as they are unborn,🔽so too are all phenomena.

original: la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la yang bzod pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The acceptance of all phenomena is called acceptance.

original: bzod pa de yang skad cig pa yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa de yang skad cig pa yin te /
translated: And that acceptance is momentary.

original: gang gis skad cig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis skad cig pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what is it momentary?

original: skad cig pa nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
translated: It is momentary by its momentariness.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
translated: Emptiness is momentary by its emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin no //
translated: Signlessness is momentary by its signlessness.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de ni de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de ni de bzhin du /
translated: Just as emptiness and signlessness are momentary by their emptiness and signlessness,

original: gzugs kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
translated: so too form is momentary by the characteristic of form.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as emptiness and signlessness are momentary due to emptiness and signlessness,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
translated: so too feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are momentary due to the characteristics of consciousness.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as emptiness and signlessness are momentary due to emptiness and signlessness,

original: chos thams cad kyi khams kyang chos kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi khams kyang chos kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin no //
translated: so too the element of dharmas is momentary due to the characteristic of the element of dharmas.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pas skad cig pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as emptiness and signlessness are momentary due to emptiness and signlessness,

original: skye mched thams cad kyang skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin te /
analyzed: skye mched thams cad kyang skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin te /
translated: so too all the sense spheres are momentary due to the characteristics of the sense spheres.

original: skad cig pa gang yin pa de ni ya ma rla yin @147b no; ;ya ma rla gang yin pa de ni gsog yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa gang yin pa de ni ya ma rla yin @147b no; ;ya ma rla gang yin pa de ni gsog yin no //
translated: What is momentary is empty.🔽What is empty is hollow.

original: gsog gang yin pa de ni gso ba yin no //🔽gso ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags med pa yin no //
analyzed: gsog gang yin pa de ni gso ba yin no // gso ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags med pa yin no //
translated: What is hollow is desireless.

original: 'dod chags med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: What is desireless is free from desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: What is free from desire is essenceless.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: What is essenceless is nonexistent.

original: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / skad cig pa dang / ya ma rla dang / dben pa dang / gsog ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / skad cig pa dang / ya ma rla dang / dben pa dang / gsog ces bya ste /
translated: This is the emptiness of all phenomena, their momentariness, their hollowness, their isolation, and their emptiness.

original: chos thams cad la de ltar bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la de ltar bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience with regard to all phenomena is called patience.

original: bzod pa de yang bzod pa nyid kyis skad cig pa yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa de yang bzod pa nyid kyis skad cig pa yin te /
translated: That patience is momentary because of its very nature.

original: de ltar mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lung bstan pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lung bstan pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained this equality is one who has received the prophecy and attained the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: bzod pa de yang dmigs pas rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa de yang dmigs pas rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
translated: This acceptance is not distinguished by an objective support.

original: de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an objective support?

original: gang gi tshe bdag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar dmigs na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar dmigs na /
translated: When both the self and acceptance are objective supports,

original: de ni dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called an objective support.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang; gang zag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar dmigs na de ni dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang; gang zag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar dmigs na de ni dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When both sentient beings, a life-force, a nourished being, a person, and acceptance are objective supports, that is called an objective support.

original: de la dmigs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of an objective support?

original: gang gi tshe bdag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When neither the self nor acceptance are objective supports, that is called the absence of an objective support.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / bzod pa gnyi gar mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When neither sentient beings, a life-force, a nourished being, a person, nor acceptance are objective supports, that is called the absence of an objective support.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: phung @148a *// po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phung @148a *// po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The essence of all phenomena, which are aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres,

original: ngo bo nyid gtan med pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gtan med pa yin no //
translated: is non-existent.

original: ngo bo nyid gtan med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gtan med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin te /
translated: That which is non-existent by nature is unconditioned.

original: ngo bo nyid de dang / bzod pa de la gnyis su rjes su rtog par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de dang / bzod pa de la gnyis su rjes su rtog par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not conceptualizing that essence and that acceptance as dual is called ‘non-apprehending.’

original: lha'i bu / bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa grangs med par spyod pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa grangs med par spyod pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Divine son, a bodhisattva who practices for countless eons with such acceptance is also a display of the great miracle of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa de la bsnyen bkur bgyi zhing /

translated: He became the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha, the one with perfect wisdom and conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassable guide who tamed beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the buddha, the bhagavān named Samantaprabhāsa.

analyzed: kun dga' bo / rgyal po legs mthong de yang dus gzhan zhig na /

translated: ‘This bodhisattva, Bhadrapāla, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening after I have passed into nirvāṇa.’

original: zhes lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And then he will pass into nirvāṇa.”

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus lha'i bu ded dpon la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: lha'i bu khyod de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan tam /

analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i @152a *//

analyzed: da ltar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du /

analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa med do //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /

translated: “Ānanda,

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba rjes su yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /

analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston cig ;kun dga' bos gsol pa /

analyzed: bdag gis bzung lags na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /

analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kun dga' bo / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
translated: “Ānanda,

analyzed: cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
translated: this Dharma discourse should be remembered as The Teaching of the Great Miracle.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: if any son or daughter of noble family

translated: “Noble sons and daughters who uphold this Dharma discourse, who have faith in it, who, having faith, write it down, read it, recite it, and teach it extensively to others,

analyzed: dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus, the venerable Ānanda, the deva chief Sārthavāha, the youthful Mañjuśrī, the entire retinue, and the world with its devas, humans, asuras, and gandharvas

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
